moves.1. d4: the London defence is an irregular defence and can also be mistaken for a cheep attack
moves.1... d5 2. Bf4 c6 3. e3: I go for the main line
moves.3... e6 4. Nc3 b6 5. Nf3 h6 6. Bd3: basic development on my part he is very weak since he ha no development
moves.6... g5: he tries to push me back but retreat is not very wise when you have a safe opening
moves.7. Be5 f6 8. Bg6+ Ke7 9. O-O: I was not very smart in castling because he can take my bishop
moves.10... Ba6 11. b3: ugh he can take my rook
the game continues in a regular manner
moves.15. Bd6+ Kd7 16. Bxe4 dxe4 17. Nfd4 Bxd6: was not a bad check but I could do better
now is when my attack starts to come through!
moves.25... Kf6 26. Qd4+ e5 27. Qd6+ Qe6 28. Q: not very strong move?? I win his queen
moves.39... Kxh3 40. Qxh6+ Kg4 41. Qg6+ Kf3 42: he can not do much with his rook now
moves.44... Rf1 45. Qb2+ Kd3: I should have taken his rook but I get it any way
moves.46. Qd4+ Kc2 47. Kxf1 Kxb3 48. Qxb6+ Kxc: moving his king around to get it in position for the kill
that was not the greatest of trade off for him
moves.54. Qe5+ Kf3 55. e4 Kg4 56. Ke2 Kg3: things are coming to an end my king is blocking his escape
moves.57. Qg5+ Kh2: checkmate in two a nice twist of ratings I have had a lot of games like this check out my annotations!!!
moves.58. Kf2 Kh3 59. Qg3#: checkmate I had it even is he did Kh1 Qg2#
